page.title: 04WATNALL WEATHER STATION
page.content: Watnall Weather Station covers the following counties-Notts.,Leics., Lincs.,Derbys.and Staffs.The weather station was used by the {armed forces} as an R.A.F. base until 1941.After 1941 it became Watnall Weather Station.The machines are paid for by the {Government Department},the Ministry of Defence,not by the weather station itself.The first room is the {communications}room where the { {computers,satellite printers and {typewriters}work.Outside there are sunshine globes,rain gauges and a Stevenson's screen which has two thermometers in it.One is wrapped in tissue which has to be kept wet.The weather station usually gets 80% to 90% of it's forecasts right.The station's code number is 354.The station has just been rebuilt.
